<RESUME_START>
TECHNICAL PROJECT MANAGER

SUMMARY

I am a PMP certified marketing, technical, and research project manager.
I currently work as a technical and research project manager at PMA Media Group.
I have led projects that include:
User Research/Testing and Product Planning UX Design and Graphics Design Web Development and Technical Software Creation Online Campaigns (Marketing Strategy and Asset Creation) SEO, Analytics, and other data points.
​I have a current Project Management Professional certificate and am working towards my Agile Project Management certificate and my IIBA Business Analyst certification.
I have not just lead projects, I am also experienced in production in the following areas:
Front end web-development UX and Graphics Design for Web sites SEO and Keyword Research Analytics for web, social, and email

SKILLS

Project Management (Including Agile Methodologies) 2.5 Years of WorkFront Experience (As well as JIRA, Trello, Slack, and others) ​Javascript, PhP, Html/Css, VBA, Multiple libraries (Jquery, Angular, etc.) Marketing Strategy for audience definition and strategy to tactics mapping
Microsoft Office, with high proficiency in Microsoft Excel Adobe Analytics Implementation and Measurement Proficiency  Capable of writing User Research scripts and Testing plans Conducting Focus groups, usability tests, surveys, and other testing methods.

WORK EXPERIENCE

<JD_START>
Job Title: Manager, Engineering

Location: Greenwood Village, CO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
TITLE: Manager, Engineering

LOCATION: Greenwood Village, CO

JOB SUMMARY: Managing a team responsible for maintaining and supporting a host of applications and tools across Charter. Coach on a host of issues, including customer support, continuous improvement, and technical matters. Collaborate with customers for the purposes of managing service queues and requests. Receive customer escalations on tool development. Attend customer meetings to assist with compiling requirements. Perform development tasks with respect to assigned tools when necessary. Assist on any maintenance or update relating to JIRA, Confluence, and Testrail. Document customer processes. Provide training on all tools as necessary. Report weekly on team performance to senior leadership. Lead and guide the team daily. Participating, once a week per month, on 24/7 on call support team. Administering JIRA and Confluence. Writing and modifying Groovy scripts. Creating and configuring API calls and working with REST API. Documenting technical processes and diagramming systems. Managing people and resources in a technical environment.

EDUCATION/REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree, or foreign equivalent, in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or related; 5 years of experience as a JIRA and Confluence administrator; 3 years of experience: writing and modifying Groovy scripts; in creating and configuring API calls and working with REST API; 2 years of experience: documenting technical processes and diagramming systems; and in managing people and resources in a technical environment. Hybrid (office and remote) arrangement is available.

This job posting will remain open until 2024-05-31 and will be extended if necessary.

The pay for this position is a salary of $158,345. The actual salary offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience and location. Also, certain positions are eligible for additional forms of compensation such as bonuses.

EGN500 2024-32281 2024

Here, employees don’t just have jobs, they build careers. That’s why we believe in offering a comprehensive pay and benefits package that rewards employees for their contributions to our success, supports all aspects of their well-being, and delivers real value at every stage of life.

A qualified applicant’s criminal history, if any, will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable laws, including local ordinances.

This job posting will remain open until 2024-05-31 11:00 PM (UTC) and will be extended if necessary.

The pay for this position has a salary range of  $158,345.00 to $175,300.00. The actual salary offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience and location. Also, certain positions are eligible for additional forms of compensation such as bonuses.

Get to Know Us Charter Communications is known in the United States by our Spectrum brands, including: Spectrum Internet®, TV, Mobile and Voice, Spectrum Networks, Spectrum Enterprise and Spectrum Reach. When you join us, you’re joining a strong community of more than 100,000 individuals working together to serve more than 32 million customers in 41 states and keep them connected to what matters most. Watch this video to learn more.

Who You Are Matters Here We’re committed to growing a workforce that reflects our communities, and providing equal opportunities for employment and advancement. EOE, including disability/vets. Learn about our inclusive culture.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
